newsitem.title: UK: Shortage of medics danger to British forces - report.
newsitem.headline: Shortage of medics danger to British forces - report.

text.p: Britain's Defence Medical Services have been cut so sharply that a future government might have to consider whether to limit the number of troops it sent into a war zone, an all-party parliamentary committee said on Thursday.
A report from the Defence Committee said the organisation's personnel had fallen to 6,946 in April last year from 9,461 in 1990 and was due to come down further under Ministry of Defence plans.

"The Defence Medical Services are not sufficient to provide proper support to the front line in all realistic planning scenarios and show little prospect of being able to do so in the future," the report said.
"A choice would have to be made between sending troops without proper medical support or only sending the limited number of troops who could be supported."
